alert.note: Alert for Marquette (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued January 13 at 2:44PM EST until January 13 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions. Additional snow accumulations of up to 3 inches. The greatest accumulations will be from Huron Mountains to Ispheming, Neguanee, Sawyer, and Skandia. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph creating blowing and drifting snow. * WHERE...Marquette County. * WHEN...Until 7 PM EST this evening. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Travel could be very difficult to impossible at times, particularly near the lakeshore. Blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Some additional accumulating lake effect snowfall will be seen in the Huron Mountains and east of US-41 tonight.
info.instruction: Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle.
